ai-pli-tv-kd2:15.1.9_0: After reciting the introduction, the four rules entailing expulsion, and the thirteen rules entailing suspension, the rest is announced as if heard.
ai-pli-tv-kd2:15.1.10_0: This is the third way of reciting the Monastic Code.

ai-pli-tv-kd2:24.1.0_0: Discussion of being seized by relatives, etc.
ai-pli-tv-kd2:24.1.1_0: On one occasion on the observance day, a certain monk was seized by his relatives.
ai-pli-tv-kd2:24.1.2_0: They told the Buddha what had happened, and he said,

ai-pli-tv-kd2:24.1.5_0: ‘Now, Venerables, let this monk do the observance-day procedure. Please do the observance-day procedure.’”
ai-pli-tv-kd2:24.2.1_0: If the other goes, all is well.
ai-pli-tv-kd2:24.2.2_0: If not, then those monks should correct those monks,
ai-pli-tv-kd2:24.2.3_0: ‘Now, Venerables, please pardon one side for a moment while on your purity.’
ai-pli-tv-kd2:24.2.4_0: If the other goes, all is well.

ai-pli-tv-kd2:24.3.5_0: ‘Now, Venerables, let this monk do the observance-day procedure. Please do the observance-day procedure.’”

ai-pli-tv-kd2:25.1.1_0: When the message had been delivered, the Buddha said to the monks,
ai-pli-tv-kd2:25.1.2_0: “Gather, monks, there’s business for the Sangha.”
ai-pli-tv-kd2:25.1.3_0: A certain monk who had done so told the Buddha,
ai-pli-tv-kd2:25.1.4_0: “Venerable Sir, there’s a monk called Gagga who is insane. He hasn’t come.”
ai-pli-tv-kd2:25.1.5_0: “Monks, there are two kinds of insane monks:
ai-pli-tv-kd2:25.1.6_0: there is the insane monk who sometimes remembers the observance-day and sometimes doesn’t, who sometimes remembers the legal procedures of the Sangha and sometimes doesn’t,
ai-pli-tv-kd2:25.1.7_0: who sometimes goes to the observance-day procedure and sometimes doesn’t, who sometimes goes to the legal procedures of the Sangha and sometimes doesn’t; and there’s the insane monk who never remembers any of this.
ai-pli-tv-kd2:25.2.1_0: For the first one of these two, I allow you to give approval in regard to insanity.
ai-pli-tv-kd2:25.3.1_0: And the designation should be given like this.
ai-pli-tv-kd2:25.3.2_0: a competent and capable monk should inform the Sangha:
ai-pli-tv-kd2:25.3.3_0: ‘Sir, let the Saṅgha listen to me.
ai-pli-tv-kd2:25.3.5_0: Sometimes he remembers the observance-day and sometimes he does not; sometimes he remembers the legal procedures of the Sangha and sometimes he does not; sometimes he goes to the observance-day procedure and sometimes he does not; sometimes he goes to the legal procedures of the Sangha and sometimes he does not.
ai-pli-tv-kd2:25.3.6_0: If it seems appropriate to the Sangha, it should agree on the following in regard to the insanity of the monk Gagga:

ai-pli-tv-kd2:25.4.6_0: Any monk who approves of this agreement
ai-pli-tv-kd2:25.4.8_0: Any monk who doesn’t approves should speak up.

ai-pli-tv-kd2:25.4.11_0: The Sangha approves and is therefore silent. I will remember it thus.’”
ai-pli-tv-kd2:26.1.0_0: Various kinds of observance days for the Sangha, etc.
ai-pli-tv-kd2:26.1.1_0: At one time on the observance day, there were four monks staying in a certain monastery.
ai-pli-tv-kd2:26.1.3_0: Knowing that the Buddha had laid down a rule against having an extra robe, he thought,
ai-pli-tv-kd2:26.1.4_0: that the observance-day procedure should be done. But there’s only four of us. How should we do the observance-day procedure?”
ai-pli-tv-kd2:26.1.5_0: They told the Buddha what had happened, and he said,
ai-pli-tv-kd2:26.1.6_0: “When there are four of you, you should recite the Monastic Code.”
ai-pli-tv-kd2:26.2.1_0: At one time on the observance day, there were three monks staying in a certain monastery.
ai-pli-tv-kd2:26.2.3_0: “The Buddha has instructed that the Monastic Code should be recited when there are four. But there’s only three of us. How should we do the observance-day procedure?”
ai-pli-tv-kd2:26.2.4_0: They told the Buddha what had happened, and he said,
ai-pli-tv-kd2:26.2.5_0: “When there are three of you, you should do the observance-day procedure by declaring your purity.
ai-pli-tv-kd2:26.3.1_0: And it should be made like this.
ai-pli-tv-kd2:26.3.2_0: A competent and capable monk should then inform those monks:
ai-pli-tv-kd2:26.3.3_0: ‘Please, Venerables, I ask you to listen.
ai-pli-tv-kd2:26.3.4_0: Today is the observance day, the fifteenth.
ai-pli-tv-kd2:26.3.5_0: If it seems appropriate to the venerables, we should do the observance-day procedure by declaring purity to one another.’
ai-pli-tv-kd2:26.3.6_0: The most senior monk should put his upper robe over one shoulder, squat on his heels, raise his joined palms, and say to those monks:
ai-pli-tv-kd2:26.4.1_0: A junior monk should put his upper robe over one shoulder, squat on his heels, raise his joined palms, and say:
ai-pli-tv-kd2:26.5.1_0: At one time on the observance day, there were two monks staying in a certain monastery.
ai-pli-tv-kd2:26.5.3_0: “The Buddha has instructed that the Monastic Code should be recited when there are four and that the observance-day procedure should be done by declaring purity when there are three.
ai-pli-tv-kd2:26.5.4_0: But there’s only two of us.
ai-pli-tv-kd2:26.5.5_0: How should we do the observance-day procedure?”
ai-pli-tv-kd2:26.5.6_0: They told the Buddha what had happened, and he said,
ai-pli-tv-kd2:26.5.7_0: “When there are two of you, you should do the observance-day procedure by declaring your purity.
ai-pli-tv-kd2:26.6.1_0: And it should be made like this.
ai-pli-tv-kd2:26.6.2_0: The most senior monk should put his upper robe over one shoulder, squat on his heels, raise his joined palms, and say to the junior monk:
ai-pli-tv-kd2:26.7.1_0: A junior monk should put his upper robe over one shoulder, squat on his heels, raise his joined palms, and say:
ai-pli-tv-kd2:26.8.1_0: At one time on the observance day, a monk was staying in a certain monastery by himself.
ai-pli-tv-kd2:26.8.3_0: “The Buddha has instructed that the Monastic Code should be recited when there are four and that the observance-day procedure should be done by declaring purity when there are two or three.
ai-pli-tv-kd2:26.8.5_0: How should I do the observance-day procedure?”
ai-pli-tv-kd2:26.8.6_0: They told the Buddha what had happened, and he said,
ai-pli-tv-kd2:26.9.1_0: “On the observance day it may happen that a monk is staying by himself in a certain monastery.
ai-pli-tv-kd2:26.9.2_0: That monk should sweep whatever place the monks normally go to: whether the assembly hall, under a roof-cover, or at the foot of a tree. He should set out water for drinking and water for washing, should prepare a seat, light a lamp, and sit down.
ai-pli-tv-kd2:26.9.3_0: If other monks come, he should do the observance-day procedure with them.
ai-pli-tv-kd2:26.9.4_0: If not, he should determine: ʻToday is my observance day.’
ai-pli-tv-kd2:26.9.5_0: If he doesn’t make a determination, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-kd2:26.10.1_0: “Wherever four monks are staying together, three shouldn’t recite the Monastic Code while one sends his purity.
ai-pli-tv-kd2:26.10.2_0: If you do recite it in this way, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-kd2:26.10.3_0: Wherever three monks are staying together, two shouldn’t do the observance-day procedure by declaring purity while one sends his purity.
ai-pli-tv-kd2:26.10.4_0: If you do it in this way, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-kd2:26.10.5_0: Wherever two monks are staying together, one shouldn’t makes a determination while one sends his purity.
ai-pli-tv-kd2:26.10.6_0: If you do make determination in this way, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”
ai-pli-tv-kd2:27.1.0_0: The process for making amends for an offense
ai-pli-tv-kd2:27.1.1_0: At one time on the observance day, a certain monk had committed an offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd2:27.1.3_0: Knowing that the Buddha had laid down a rule against having an extra robe, he thought,
ai-pli-tv-kd2:27.1.4_0: that the observance-day procedure shouldn’t be done.
ai-pli-tv-kd2:27.1.6_0: So what should I do now?”
ai-pli-tv-kd2:27.1.7_0: They told the Buddha what had happened, and he said,
ai-pli-tv-kd2:27.1.8_0: “On the observance day it may happen that a monk has committed an offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd2:27.1.9_0: That monk should approach a single monk, put his upper robe over one shoulder, squat on his heels, raise his joined palms, and say:
ai-pli-tv-kd2:27.1.10_0: ʻI have committed such-and-such an offense. I confess it.’
ai-pli-tv-kd2:27.2.1_0: On the observance day it may happen that a monk is unsure if he’s committed an offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd2:27.2.2_0: That monk should approach a single monk, put his upper robe over one shoulder, squat on his heels, raise his joined palms, and say:
ai-pli-tv-kd2:27.2.3_0: ‘I’m unsure if I’ve committed such-and-such an offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd2:27.2.4_0: I’ll make amends for it when I’m sure.’ He can then take part in the observance-day procedure by listening to the recitation of the Monastic Code. You shouldn’t allow this to create an obstacle to the doing of the observance-day procedure.”
ai-pli-tv-kd2:27.3.1_0: On one occasion the monks from the group of six confessed shared offenses to one another.
ai-pli-tv-kd2:27.3.2_0: They told the Buddha what had happened, and he said,
ai-pli-tv-kd2:27.3.3_0: “You should not confess shared offenses to one another.
ai-pli-tv-kd2:27.3.4_0: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”
ai-pli-tv-kd2:27.3.5_0: On one occasion the monks from the group of six received the confession of shared offenses from one another.
ai-pli-tv-kd2:27.3.6_0: They told the Buddha what had happened, and he said,
ai-pli-tv-kd2:27.3.7_0: “You should not receive the confession of shared offenses from one another.
ai-pli-tv-kd2:27.3.8_0: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”
ai-pli-tv-kd2:27.4.0_0: The process for revealing an offense
ai-pli-tv-kd2:27.4.1_0: At one time a certain monk remembered an offense while the Monastic Code was being recited.
ai-pli-tv-kd2:27.4.3_0: Knowing that the Buddha had laid down a rule against having an extra robe, he thought,
ai-pli-tv-kd2:27.4.4_0: that the observance-day procedure shouldn’t be done.
ai-pli-tv-kd2:27.4.6_0: So what should I do now?”
ai-pli-tv-kd2:27.4.7_0: They told the Buddha what had happened, and he said,
ai-pli-tv-kd2:27.4.8_0: “It may happen that a monk remembers an offense while the Monastic Code is being recited.
ai-pli-tv-kd2:27.4.11_0: Once this meeting is finished, I’ll make amends for it.’ They can then continue the observance-day procedure by listening to the recitation of the Monastic Code. You shouldn’t allow this to create an obstacle to the doing of the observance-day procedure.
ai-pli-tv-kd2:27.5.1_0: It may happen, while the Monastic Code is being recited, that a monk becomes unsure if he’s committed an offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd2:27.5.3_0: ʻI’m unsure if I’ve committed such-and-such an offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd2:27.5.4_0: I’ll make amends for it when I’m sure.’ They can then continue the observance-day procedure by listening to the recitation of the Monastic Code.
ai-pli-tv-kd2:27.5.5_0: You shouldn’t allow this to create an obstacle to the doing of the observance-day procedure.”
ai-pli-tv-kd2:27.6.0_0: And they received the confession of shared offenses by one another.
ai-pli-tv-kd2:27.6.1_0: At one time on the observance day, the whole sangha in a certain monastery had committed the same offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd2:27.6.3_0: Knowing that the Buddha had laid down a rule against having an extra robe, he thought,
ai-pli-tv-kd2:27.6.4_0: ‘Nothing should not be received, nor shared offenses.’
ai-pli-tv-kd2:27.6.5_0: and this whole sangha has committed it.
ai-pli-tv-kd2:27.6.6_0: So what should we do now?”
ai-pli-tv-kd2:27.6.7_0: They told the Buddha what had happened, and he said,
ai-pli-tv-kd2:27.6.8_0: “On the observance day it may happen that the whole sangha in a certain monastery has committed the same offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd2:27.6.9_0: they should straightaway send one monk to a neighboring monastery
ai-pli-tv-kd2:27.6.10_0: ʻGo and make amends for this offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd2:27.6.11_0: When you return, we’ll make amends for it in your presence.’
ai-pli-tv-kd2:27.7.1_0: If the other goes, all is well.
ai-pli-tv-kd2:27.7.2_0: If not, then a competent and capable monk should inform the Sangha:
ai-pli-tv-kd2:27.7.3_0: ‘Sir, let the Saṅgha listen to me.
ai-pli-tv-kd2:27.7.4_0: but this whole sangha has committed it.
ai-pli-tv-kd2:27.7.5_0: When the Sangha sees another monk who is pure and free from offenses, it should make amends for this offense in his presence.’
ai-pli-tv-kd2:27.7.6_0: Once this has been said, they can do the observance-day procedure by listening to the recitation of the Monastic Code.
ai-pli-tv-kd2:27.7.7_0: You shouldn’t allow this to create an obstacle to the doing of the observance-day procedure.
ai-pli-tv-kd2:27.8.1_0: “On the observance day it may happen that the whole sangha in a certain monastery is unsure if it has committed the same offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd2:27.8.2_0: a competent and capable monk should inform the Sangha:
ai-pli-tv-kd2:27.8.3_0: ‘Sir, let the Saṅgha listen to me.
ai-pli-tv-kd2:27.8.4_0: but this whole sangha was unsure of it.
ai-pli-tv-kd2:27.8.5_0: When the Sangha is sure, it should make amends for this offense.’
ai-pli-tv-kd2:27.8.6_0: Once this has been said, they can do the observance-day procedure by listening to the recitation of the Monastic Code.
ai-pli-tv-kd2:27.8.7_0: You shouldn’t allow this to create an obstacle to the doing of the observance-day procedure.
ai-pli-tv-kd2:27.9.1_0: “When a sangha has entered the rainy-season residence in a certain monastery, it may happen that the whole sangha has committed the same offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd2:27.9.2_0: they should straightaway send one monk to a neighboring monastery
ai-pli-tv-kd2:27.9.3_0: ʻGo and make amends for this offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd2:27.9.4_0: When you return, we’ll make amends for it in your presence.’
ai-pli-tv-kd2:27.9.5_0: If the other goes, all is well.
ai-pli-tv-kd2:27.9.6_0: If not, they should send one monk using the seven-day allowance:
ai-pli-tv-kd2:27.9.7_0: ʻGo and make amends for this offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd2:27.9.8_0: When you return, we’ll make amends for it in your presence.’”
ai-pli-tv-kd2:27.10.1_0: Soon afterwards the whole sangha in a certain monastery had committed the same offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd2:27.10.2_0: They did not know the name or the class of that offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd2:27.10.3_0: Then a monk arrives who is learned and a master of the tradition; who is an expert on the Teaching, the Monastic Law, and the summaries; who is knowledgeable and competent, has a sense of conscience, and is afraid of wrongdoing and fond of the training.
ai-pli-tv-kd2:27.10.4_0: One monk approached him and asked,
ai-pli-tv-kd2:27.10.5_0: “When someone does such-and-such, what’s the name of the offense he’s committed?”
ai-pli-tv-kd2:27.11.2_0: “When someone does such-and-such, he’s committed an offense with this name.
ai-pli-tv-kd2:27.11.3_0: If you have committed this offense,
ai-pli-tv-kd2:27.11.4_0: you should make amends for it.”
ai-pli-tv-kd2:27.11.6_0: “It’s not just I alone who have committed this offense,
ai-pli-tv-kd2:27.11.7_0: but this whole sangha has committed it.”
